001package net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns;
002
003import java.lang.annotation.*;
004
005/**
006 * Marks a class or type as a <b>Holder</b> structure.
007 * <p>
008 * A Holder is a lightweight helper pattern whose primary purpose is to
009 * encapsulate and expose a reference to a value. It is often used in
010 * situations where a simple mutable container is required, for example:
011 * <ul>
012 *   <li>Passing values into lambdas or anonymous classes where variables must be effectively final.</li>
013 *   <li>Encapsulating a mutable reference for convenience or readability.</li>
014 *   <li>Providing a simple mechanism for wrapping, clearing, or lazily updating a value.</li>
015 * </ul>
016 */
017@Documented
018@DesignPattern(DesignPattern.Category.HELPER_STRUCTURES)
019@Retention(RetentionPolicy.SOURCE)
020@Target(ElementType.TYPE)
021public @interface Holder {
022}
